Trumpet archons are messengers, emissaries, and storytellers—embodiments of the virtue of kindness. They use stories and allegories to prevent bloodshed, and among all archons they are the most likely to work together with angels, perhaps leading to the similarities in their forms. When diplomacy is impossible, trumpet archons rally the righteous to battle—one reassuring glance from a trumpet archon is often all it takes to instill a shaken ally with resounding courage once again. **[Recall Knowledge - Celestial](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Trumpet Archon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=552) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 23 2.0 **Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +29, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +28, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +23, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +23, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +31, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +5 **Int** +3 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +8 **Items** _+2 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [bastard sword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=15)_, _+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [full plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13)_, [virtuoso trumpet](/Equipment.aspx?ID=37) --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +24 **Will** +27 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 285 **Resistances** sonic 15 **Weaknesses** evil 15 **[Retributive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=31)** --- **Speed** 35 feet, fly 60 feet **Melee** bastard sword +29 ([Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 2d12+13 slashing plus 2d6 sonic and 1d6 good **Divine Innate Spells** DC 34 - **Cantrips (6th)** [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190) - **3rd** [Circle of Protection](/Spells.aspx?ID=38) (against evil only; ×2) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will) - **5th** [Banishment](/Spells.aspx?ID=19), [Breath of Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=29) - **6th** [Heroism](/Spells.aspx?ID=149), [Zealous Conviction](/Spells.aspx?ID=378) - **7th** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×2), [Sound Burst](/Spells.aspx?ID=292) - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Archon's Door** Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast [_dimension door_](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), the archon can use dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either creature used dimension door. **Kind Word** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The trumpet archon offers an ally praise or encouragement. The archon attempts to counteract one [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effect on the ally (with a counteract modifier of +24), and the archon and the ally both gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws for 1 round. **Trumpet Blast** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The trumpet archon blows mightily on their horn, creating a tone of such beauty and grandeur those who hear it are paralyzed in awe. Non-archons within 100 feet must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save. They are temporarily immune for 10 minutes.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16).
**Failure** The creature is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) and flat-footed as long as it's stunned.
**Critical Failure** The creature is [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round.
Instruments of War A trumpet archon's magical instrument is no mere piece of brass; each of these immaculately crafted horns is said to be crafted in Heaven's blessed forges and infused with the voices of a thousand angels. Only archons can truly play such trumpets—mortals lack the power necessary to create trumpet archons' iconic clarion calls, but can still play them as virtuoso instruments.
